history.proof: unfold Rbar_mult'. destruct x, y; simpl; try destruct (Rle_dec 0 r), (Rle_dec 0 r0); auto. - shelve. - shelve. - shelve. - shelve.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
y: Rbar
x: Rbar

Goal:
Rbar_mult' x y = Rbar_mult' y x

Premises:
Rbar_mult' = fun x y : Rbar => match x with | Finite x0 => match y with | Finite y0 => Some (x0 * y0) | p_infty => match Rle_dec 0 x0 with | left H => if Rle_lt_or_eq_dec 0 x0 H then Some p_infty else None | right _ => Some m_infty end | m_infty => match Rle_dec 0 x0 with | left H => if Rle_lt_or_eq_dec 0 x0 H then Some m_infty else None | right _ => Some p_infty end end | p_infty => match y with | Finite y0 => match Rle_dec 0 y0 with | left H => if Rle_lt_or_eq_dec 0 y0 H then Some p_infty else None | right _ => Some m_infty end | p_infty => Some p_infty | m_infty => Some m_infty end | m_infty => match y with | Finite y0 => match Rle_dec 0 y0 with | left H => if Rle_lt_or_eq_dec 0 y0 H then Some
is_Rbar_mult = fun x y z : Rbar => Rbar_mult' x y = Some z : Rbar -> Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
Rbar_mult = fun x y : Rbar => match Rbar_mult' x y with | Some z => z | None => Finite 0 end : Rbar -> Rbar -> Rbar
Rbar_finite_eq : forall x y : R, x = y < -> x = y
Rbar_opp_eq : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_opp x = Rbar_opp y < -> x = y
Rbar_le_antisym : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_le x y -> Rbar_le y x -> x = y
f_equal_R : forall (B : Type) (f : R -> B) (x y : R), x = y -> f x = f y
Rbar_plus'_comm : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_plus' x y = Rbar_plus' y x
Rbar_plus_comm : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_plus x y = Rbar_plus y x
is_Rbar_plus_unique : forall x y z : Rbar, is_Rbar_plus x y z -> Rbar_plus x y = z
is_Rbar_mult_unique : forall x y z : Rbar, is_Rbar_mult x y z -> Rbar_mult x y = z
is_Rbar_plus = fun x y z : Rbar => Rbar_plus' x y = Some z : Rbar -> Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
Rbar_opp_minus : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_opp (Rbar_minus x y) = Rbar_minus y x
Rbar_le_lt_or_eq_dec : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_le x y -> {Rbar_lt x y} + {x = y}
Rbar_total_order : forall x y : Rbar, {Rbar_lt x y} + {x = y} + {Rbar_lt y x}
ex_Rbar_plus = fun x y : Rbar => match Rbar_plus' x y with | Some _ => True | None => False end : Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
Rbar_plus = fun x y : Rbar => match Rbar_plus' x y with | Some z => z | None => Finite 0 end : Rbar -> Rbar -> Rbar
is_finite_correct : forall x : Rbar, is_finite x < -> (exists y : R, x = y)
Rbar_eq_dec : forall x y : Rbar, {x = y} + {x <> y}
Rbar_plus_opp : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_plus (Rbar_opp x) (Rbar_opp y) = Rbar_opp (Rbar_plus x y)
Rbar_minus = fun x y : Rbar => Rbar_plus x (Rbar_opp y) : Rbar -> Rbar -> Rbar
ex_Rbar_minus = fun x y : Rbar => ex_Rbar_plus x (Rbar_opp y) : Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
Rbar_div = fun x y : Rbar => Rbar_mult x (Rbar_inv y) : Rbar -> Rbar -> Rbar
ex_Rbar_div = fun x y : Rbar => ex_Rbar_mult x (Rbar_inv y) : Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
ex_Rbar_mult = fun x y : Rbar => match x with | Finite x0 => match y with | Finite _ => True | _ => x0 <> 0 end | _ => match y with | Finite y0 => y0 <> 0 | _ => True end end : Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
is_Rbar_minus = fun x y z : Rbar => is_Rbar_plus x (Rbar_opp y) z : Rbar -> Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
is_Rbar_div = fun x y z : Rbar => is_Rbar_mult x (Rbar_inv y) z : Rbar -> Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
Rbar_le = fun x y : Rbar => match x with | Finite x0 => match y with | Finite y0 => x0 <= y0 | p_infty => True | m_infty => False end | p_infty => match y with | p_infty => True | _ => False end | m_infty => True end : Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
Rbar_lt = fun x y : Rbar => match x with | Finite x0 => match y with | Finite y0 => x0 < y0 | p_infty => True | m_infty => False end | p_infty => False | m_infty => match y with | m_infty => False | _ => True end end : Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0%Z => y | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0%Z => x | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' + y') | Z.neg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0%Z => x | Z.pos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' + y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Argument scopes are [Z_scope Z_scope]
Rbar_plus' = fun x y : Rbar => match x with | Finite x' => match y with | Finite y' => Some (x' + y') | p_infty => Some p_infty | m_infty => Some m_infty end | p_infty => match y with | m_infty => None | _ => Some p_infty end | m_infty => match y with | p_infty => None | _ => Some m_infty end end : Rbar -> Rbar -> option Rbar
Rbar_lt_not_eq : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_lt x y -> x <> y
Rbar_le_not_lt : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_le y x -> ~ Rbar_lt x y
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0%Z => 0%Z | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0%Z => 0%Z | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' * y') end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0%Z => 0%Z | Z.pos y' => Z.neg (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.pos (x' * y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Argument scopes are [Z_scope Z_scope]
Zeq_bool = fun x y : Z => match (x ?= y)%Z with | Eq => true | _ => false end : Z -> Z -> bool Argument scopes are [Z_scope Z_scope]
is_finite = fun x : Rbar => x = x : Rbar -> Prop
Rbar_plus_0_l : forall x : Rbar, Rbar_plus 0 x = x
Rbar_minus_eq_0 : forall x : Rbar, Rbar_minus x x = 0
Rbar_plus_0_r : forall x : Rbar, Rbar_plus x 0 = x
Rbar_opp_involutive : forall x : Rbar, Rbar_opp (Rbar_opp x) = x
Byte.of_to_N : forall x : Byte.byte, Byte.of_N (Byte.to_N x) = Some x

```coq
unfold Rbar_mult'. destruct x, y; simpl; try destruct (Rle_dec 0 r), (Rle_dec 0 r0); auto.
Qed.```
